page.title: 14ROAD WORKS
page.content: During the middle of May 1985 the council had to rebuild the road in Dallington street,because of effect of the hard winter.It is the first time that this method of road repair has been used in the British Isles on a public road.The work was very succesful altough it only took 5 daysto complete.(Normally it would taken 3-4 weeks.)The materials used were chopped up glass fibre,stone chippings(6mm),clay,surface dressing,biton and insulation.The cost was estimated at Â£19,000.Only 15 men were involved.The vehicles involved were 2 types of rotovater,one was called the bomag MPH100,grader,roller, cement layer and the tar lorry.They had to repair 2960 square metres of road.The work hours were between 8-12 perday.
